did.abstract: The school record book of teacher Henrietta Covert from Jamaica, Long Island.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of the New Canaan Historical Society, 1975.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection consists of a single volume.

bioghist.head: Biographical note
bioghist.p: Henrietta Covert was born to Charity and Jerome Covert around 1859-1860, one of at least five children. Her parents had married in Roslyn, NY in 1835 and moved to Jamaica in 1854. Jerome Covert had the warehouse business Covert & Acker in Manhattan. Henrietta died at her home on Douglass Street in Jamaica of a sudden brain hemmorhage in July 1904 at 44 years of age.

prefercite.p: Henrietta Covert school record book, circa 1883, 1978.051, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Public Library, Center for Brooklyn History.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection was rehoused and the finding aid revised by Dee Bowers in 2023.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The school record book of Henrietta Covert from Jamaica, Long Island. The volume contains entries from March through October circa 1883 listing student names and scores for their "deportment and merit," indicating that Covert was a teacher. The volume also contains various newspaper clippings, both loose and pasted in, as well as a program from Jamaica Public School Graduating exercises from 1877.
